body: Tamada Tales, a EurasiaNet blog, comments on plans by an Armenian peace activist to establish a peace building center in a village situated close to the intersection of Armenia, Azerbaijan, and Georgia. Noting that Armenians and Azerbaijanis are "implacable foes," the blog notes that Georgia has often proven itself to be the one location where both can co-exist or communicate with the other.
original_body: Tamada Tales, a EurasiaNet blog, comments on plans by an Armenian peace activist to establish a peace building center in a village situated close to the intersection of Armenia, Azerbaijan, and Georgia. Noting that Armenians and Azerbaijanis are "implacable foes," the blog notes that Georgia has often proven itself to be the one location where both can co-exist or communicate with the other.
title: Caucasus: Peace Village

sentence: Tamada Tales, a EurasiaNet blog, comments on plans by an Armenian peace activist to establish a peace building center in a village situated close to the intersection of Armenia, Azerbaijan, and Georgia.
Noting that Armenians and Azerbaijanis are "implacable foes," the blog notes that Georgia has often proven itself to be the one location where both can co-exist or communicate with the other.
